li.a: When to Keep a Student Home

span.div: The Bishop Griffin Resource Center (BGRC) has a drive-thru food pick up for those that are food challenged, They are located at the corner of Livingston Ave. and Wellsley Rd. In order to pick up, drive through in your car, show ID, and volunteers will load food in your trunk.
Mid Ohio Food Bank is also passing out free food at 3960 Brookman Dr. (just off 71S and Stringtown Rd). It has same pick up protocol stated above.
Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays - 8:30 a.m. - 12:00 p.m.
Wednesdays - 8:30 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. and 5:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m.
To donate food to BGRC, email Terri Schwallie ([email protected]) or drop off to BGRC directly:

a.typing-node: Governor DeWine: For the remainder of this school year, our young people will continue to go to school remotely.

span.em: The following is the Superintedent's District Update from April 16, 2020.

p.span:
Every June the Bexley Schools administrative team gathers for a retreat. We review our progress toward goals from the previous year and set our goals for the upcoming year. In June 2019, I began our retreat by asking each administrator to set forth a phrase or word that was going to guide them in the next school year. I asked them to create their 2019-2020 hashtag. Mine was #Hope.
As I anticipated this school year and all that we planned to accomplish, I had a great sense of hope...
Watch: Dr. Miller checks in to give a quick update on the district.
On Monday, April 13, we entered Phase II of distance learning. This phase will end on Friday, May 1. Below are the goals and expectations for both elementary and secondary students.

li.span: We seek to provide students with a daily connection to their school community.
We seek to provide experiences that support the social, emotional, and physical wellness of our students.
We seek to provide opportunities for students to practice, review, and maintain essential learning skills.
We will engage students in a variety of learning experiences to grow their learning and understanding of new content.
Provide experiences that support the social, emotional and physical wellness of each student.
Provide continued instruction that supports students practicing, reviewing, maintaining and building essential learning skills.
Provide experiences that connect each student to their (our) learning community on a daily basis.

p.span: If you would like to be added to the Bexley City Schools food distribution list, fill out this form.
Please email your school’s counselor for any school-related support.
The City of Bexley has created a form to gauge needs in our city. If your family needs assistance, please complete this survey.

All three elementary schools will be holding Kindergarten Orientation on Thursday, April 23rd at 6:30 p.m. Parents who have registered their child will receive an email invitation to a Zoom video meeting from our school secretaries.

br.span: To register a child for kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year, click here.

div.h3: Experiential Learning - Practicing Medicine During a Pandemic

p.span: Experiential Learning Coordinator Steve Shapiro hosts Practicing Medicine During a Pandemic. This event features two local doctors, who share their experiences of being a medical professional during the coronavirus outbreak.

span.span: Follow the official Bexley City School District social media sites:

span.em: The following is the weekly Superintendent's District Update from April 9, 2020.

span.p: Let’s all continue to extend understanding and grace to each other, including to yourself, your students at home, and our teachers and principals. We all have other stressors beyond school. Many of you are balancing work while trying to assist your students in their learning and we understand the stress of that situation.

There will be no distance learning tomorrow, Friday, April 10. We have encouraged our staff members to take this time off and not to respond to any emails. To those observing, we hope you enjoy the holiday.
Watch: Bexley Chief Academic Officer Jill Abraham provides an update as the district moves into Phase II of distance learning.

div.span: Last week, we sent out a distance learning feedback survey. Because we did not ask for names and email addresses, we are unable to respond to specific questions or comments. We greatly appreciate the community’s feedback as we continue to evaluate and improve our distance learning methods. Having never encountered this type of educational environment, we must rely on your feedback to make adjustments and plan for Phase II, which will take us through May 1.
There are a few topics mentioned throughout the feedback that we’d like to address for the community. Other building or content-specific feedback is being addressed by principals and teachers.

li.span: We are going to use the feedback to make adjustments. However, please understand that there is no uniform message about how to do that. What may work for one family may not work for another family. For example, some parents want more work for their children while others are concerned that the workload is too great. Our teachers are working to create activities and assignments that meet the needs of all children and will use the feedback provided to continue to adjust. Please email your child’s teachers about their assignments if you have a concern or question so they are aware of the concern as they are best suited to address it.

We received comments about our technology challenges. We agree that we are behind where we want to be in technology. In fact, I communicated this message throughout the levy campaign. Not investing in technology was one of the reasons Bexley Schools stayed off the ballot for nine years. Upon my arrival in Bexley three years ago, one of my first observations was the lack of technology resources. This concern was also noted by students, staff, and parents during the strategic planning process in the spring of 2018. Therefore, developing a technology plan to guide technology improvements was a goal for the 2018-2019 school year. Brad Pettit, Bexley Schools Director of Technology, began working on the development of our technology plan by convening a task force made up of former students, staff, and community members in the fall of 2018. The task force developed a technology plan that was approved by the Bexley Schools Board of Education on June 10, 2019. This plan includes the development of a process to phase in a 1:1 (one device per student) system. At the April 7, 2020, board of education meeting, I recommended to the board that we address our technology plan with a sense of urgency. We should not become a 1:1 district because of the virus, but we should accelerate our plan at this time.

We received many requests for live lessons, and we know that some of our teachers are working on providing more. As we move into Phase II of distance learning, we will continue to work on video lessons. Because we are not currently a 1:1 district, we know that not all households have multiple devices and some students may be sharing. Therefore, it will not be possible for all students to attend a live lesson. We also know that internet access is an issue for some, and we are working to support those families. Still, we hear the request, and we will work to do more.

During the school closures, we have established a consistent workday for all teachers, which is 8:00 a.m to 4:00 p.m. In Phase I, we identified 9:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. as the hours teachers would be online to answer questions in real-time. Now that we have two weeks of experience, we are making adjustments to those online hours at the different levels. Principals are working with their teachers on this topic. Any communication regarding updated office hours will be communicated by teachers. Of course, you can email teachers at any time as always.

span.p: Throughout this process, we have asked for your patience. Thank you. And we must be patient with you and our students as well. This is a new environment with new challenges and opportunities. And each of us - parents, students, teachers, principals, and central office administrators- must give and receive patience if we are going to make it through this time better and stronger. I know that we can do just that.
